summary: The 2024 UTSU club fair is an event for new and returning students at the University of Toronto, featuring opportunities to meet executives, receive free gifts, and learn about various clubs.
title: 2024 UTSU Club Fair Invitation

summary: Join us for a free, hands-on bicycle maintenance workshop where participants will learn easy techniques for cleaning and maintaining their bikes. This interactive session will allow attendees to practice maintenance steps on their own bikes.
title: Free Bicycle Maintenance Workshop

summary: Join us for a fun evening bike ride to Scooped in the Distillery District for ice cream. This is a no-drop ride at a talking pace, welcoming all cyclists. Bring your bike, water, and cash/card for ice cream.
title: Ice Cream Bike Ride to Scooped

location: Good Behaviour at Davenport on Westmoreland
summary: Join us for a fun evening bike ride to enjoy ice cream at Good Behaviour. Meet at Bikechain at 6:00 PM and we'll depart by 6:15 PM. This is a no-drop ride, welcoming all cyclists.
title: Ice Cream Bike Ride to Good Behaviour

summary: The Learn-to-Bike Workshop is a free program designed for individuals of all ages and abilities to learn how to ride a bike. The workshop is limited to eight participants, with the possibility of accommodating two additional participants who can bring their own bicycles. It includes certified instructors, provision of bikes and helmets, and a free helmet for those who complete all four sessions.
title: Learn-to-Bike Workshop

summary: Join us for a Film Night featuring 'The Lighthouse' and 'Antichrist' at the Graduate Students' Union Pub. Enjoy a night of film, food, and drinks with subtitles provided for the films. Snacks will be available, and attendees are welcome to bring their own.
title: Film Night at GSU Pub

location: booth G59, close to the south side of Front Campus
summary: Join us at the Clubs Fair to meet the executive team, learn about our plans for the year, and register as a member. Engage with fellow enthusiasts of board games, card games, and role-playing games.

summary: Miniature Mondays is a weekly event where participants can play miniature war games, paint miniatures, and socialize. First-time attendees can build and paint a miniature for free, with supplies available for members and non-members.

summary: Join us for a film night on Discord featuring 'The Crow' and 'Alien' with subtitles. Enjoy a fun evening filled with films and games.

summary: The GM101 event is designed for individuals interested in learning how to run a role-playing game (RPG). It is system neutral, making it applicable to any RPG system, and is aimed at those with limited experience. This event will take place during the General Game Night and will be a regular monthly feature starting in September.
title: GM101: Introduction to Running RPGs

title: Gaslight Gatekeep Girlboss Gaming Event

summary: Join the University of Toronto Tabletop Gaming Club for a fun-filled General Game Night every Friday. Enjoy a variety of games including board games, RPGs, card games, and video games. Everyone is welcome, and attendees can bring their own games or consoles.

summary: Join us for a film night on Discord featuring the movies 'Pretty Village, Pretty Flame' and 'Gymkata'. Enjoy subtitles and a fun evening with fellow film enthusiasts.

summary: Miniature Mondays is a weekly event where participants can play miniature war games, paint miniatures, and socialize. First-time attendees can build and paint a miniature for free, with supplies available for members and non-members.
title: Miniature Mondays at Student Commons

location: Kings College Circle, Front Campus of UofT
summary: The Clubs Carnival is an exciting event at the University of Toronto, designed to kick off the school year. Attendees can explore over 300 clubs, enjoy food from various food trucks, and connect with new friends.
title: Clubs Carnival 2023: Kickstart Your School Year!

summary: The Annual UTSU Orientation Cheer Off is an event to kick off the new academic year, featuring a cheer competition, music from a UofT Student DJ, and a Presidential address from Shehab Mansour. Attendees are encouraged to show their school spirit and enjoy the festivities.
title: Annual UTSU Orientation Cheer Off

location: UofT Back Campus and Kings College Circle, Front Campus of UofT
summary: The UTSU Orientation Day features a Clubs Fair and Cheer-Off, offering students a chance to connect with over 300 clubs, enjoy food from trucks, and participate in a cheer competition with a DJ. The event includes a Presidential address and aims to kick off the school year with excitement and school spirit.
title: UTSU Orientation Day: Clubs Fair & Cheer-Off

summary: The Clubs' Carnival is a free event where all students are invited to attend the Cheer-off and Club’s Carnival. All club tables have been reserved, and the event is sold out for club participation.

summary: The University of Toronto is launching a Tri-Campus Credit/No Credit Campaign aimed at lobbying for changes to the Credit/No Credit Policy. Undergraduate students are encouraged to participate by taking a survey to express their needs regarding the policy.
title: Tri-Campus Credit/No Credit Campaign Launch

summary: The UTSU Annual General Meeting will take place on October 20th at 1 PM. Registration opens on September 20th and closes on October 15th. Attendees have a chance to win one of three $75 Amazon gift cards.
title: UTSU Annual General Meeting

summary: The UTSU Food Bank is seeking volunteers to help address food insecurity on campus by providing a free, year-round service to UofT students in need of food. Interested individuals can apply by sending a resume and cover letter.

summary: The event was the first Students Union Coalition Meeting involving various student unions from the University of Toronto. The meeting focused on collaboration for the upcoming year to enhance the student movement through organizing events, providing services, and advocating for free and accessible education.

summary: An event aimed at welcoming and engaging the incoming freshman class of 2028 at the University of Toronto.

Benefits include flexible tasks, skill development, free workshops, volunteer certificates, and community building.

summary: The Residence Crash Course is an informative event designed for new students at Innis, providing essential tips and tricks about residence life from upper year students. Attendees can learn about laundry, meal ideas, and other aspects of living in residence.

summary: Join UofT Rocket Riders for a fun-filled game night focused on transit knowledge, featuring games, a team-based Kahoot, and snacks. Open to all, including non-members.

summary: The Rocket Riders student club is offering a special promotion where new members can join for just $5. This offer is available now and will also be applicable at the upcoming clubs fair.

summary: The application deadline for becoming a Robonars Associate has been extended to August 10th, 2024. This role offers an opportunity to engage in event organization and networking within the robotics community.

summary: This event is a call for applications for project proposals, where team leads can form and lead their own project teams, collaborate with developers, and present their projects at UTMIST showcase events throughout the year. The deadline for applications is August 16th at 11:59 PM EST.
title: Final Call for Project Proposals - Applications Due August 16th

summary: Applications for the 2024-2025 Associates & Directors positions are due on August 5th at 11:59 PM EST. Various roles are available across different departments, and applications will be reviewed on a rolling basis.
title: 2024-2025 Associates & Directors Application Deadline

summary: The UTJA will be participating in the Clubs' Fair at the University of Toronto, inviting attendees to discover their offerings.
title: UTJA at the Clubs' Fair

summary: The VOFT Japan Association is excited to announce Nanami as the new president for the upcoming semester, emphasizing her leadership and vision for the club's future.
title: Introduction of New UTJA President

summary: The event announces Hina as the new vice president of the VOFT Japan Association, highlighting her drive and creative vision for the club's future.
title: Announcement of New Vice President

summary: The VOFT Japan Association is announcing Kento as their new Finance Director for the 2024/2025 term. Kento is recognized for his financial management skills and is expected to contribute significantly to the association's financial success.
title: Announcement of New Finance Director

summary: The VOFT Japan Association is introducing Miri and Irene as their new Creative and Media Administrators, highlighting their talents and the innovative ideas they will bring to enhance the association's creative projects and media presence.
title: Introduction of New Creative and Media Administrators

summary: The VOFT Japan Association has announced Jacob as their External Affairs Director for the 2024/2025 term. His role will focus on community engagement and fostering partnerships to enhance the association's impact.
title: Announcement of New External Affairs Director

summary: The VOFT Japan Association is introducing their new External Representatives, Atlas and Ian, who will focus on outreach and building partnerships to enhance the club's community presence. Their innovative ideas and proactive approach are expected to make a significant impact this year.
title: Introducing New External Representatives for VOFT Japan Association

summary: The VOFT Japan Association is welcoming Haruta back as the Internal Affairs Director, highlighting his organizational skills and commitment to improving internal processes for the club. The post expresses excitement for the upcoming year and the positive changes expected.
title: Welcome Back Haruta: Internal Affairs Director Announcement

summary: The UTJA (University of Toronto Japan Association) is announcing its new executive team for the year, consisting of Delia, Jiwoo, and Celine as Internal Representatives. They aim to enhance internal dynamics, improve communication, and foster collaboration within the club.
title: Announcement of New Executives for UTJA

summary: Join a virtual seminar to explore the clubs at the University of Toronto, including iGEM Toronto. Learn about student-led initiatives, projects in synthetic biology, and connect with other clubs. This event is an opportunity to find your community and enhance your university experience.
title: Explore UofT Clubs: Virtual Seminar

summary: The iGEM Toronto x Hart House Debate Club event will focus on the intersection of AI and biotechnology, specifically debating the role of generative AI in addressing antibiotic resistance. Participants can engage as debaters, audience members, or guest speakers while enjoying free pizza and drinks.
title: Debate on AI and Antibiotic Resistance

location: Devonshire Place next to Varsity Field
summary: Join us at the UTSU Club Fair to learn about our work and recruitment opportunities for the upcoming school year. Enjoy some stickers and find us at booth E47!
title: UTSU Club Fair - Global Brigades

summary: The University of Toronto Global Brigades (UTGB) is recruiting for multiple executive positions focused on sustainable development and community empowerment. The program partners with communities in Central America to address health and economic disparities. Interested individuals are encouraged to apply to join a team of like-minded individuals and gain valuable skills for their future careers.
title: UTGB Executive Recruitment for Sustainable Development

summary: The University of Toronto Global Brigades is recruiting for multiple executive positions focused on sustainable development and community empowerment in Central America. Interested individuals are encouraged to apply to build skills and gain valuable experiences.
title: U of T Global Brigades Executive Recruitment

summary: Iron Dragons is recruiting for the 2024-25 season, inviting individuals to join their competitive and recreational dragon boating teams. The event emphasizes inclusivity, with no prior paddling experience required, and offers opportunities for socializing and training. Participants can look forward to info sessions and a 'give-it-a-try' day, with free pizza mentioned.
title: Join Iron Dragons for the 2024-25 Season Recruitment

summary: The office will be closed until September 3rd, with the last day to pick up bulk orders on August 21st from 1-5 pm. The team will also be present at orientation events across campus.

summary: Join Professor Erica Rosenblum for a talk on her research regarding the Earth's cryosphere and oceans, along with insights into her academic journey. title: PhySU Prof Talk: Research on Earth's Cryosphere and Oceans

summary: The Bridging Past, Present, and Future in Latin American Health: Student Symposium event aims to connect students with Latin healthcare professionals to discuss improving health outcomes for the Latin American community in Toronto. It offers mentorship and support for Latin students pursuing healthcare careers.
title: Bridging Past, Present, and Future in Latin American Health: Student Symposium

summary: Join the Canadian Association of Latin Medical Students (CALMS) for an exhibition game with York United FC. Support a great cause as $5 from every ticket sold will be donated to CALMS to aid Latin medical students and promote diversity in professional fields. Everyone is welcome to cheer on the team and enjoy the game!
title: Latin Celebration Day: Support CALMS at York United FC Exhibition Game

summary: NSBE is hiring for various positions and invites everyone to apply for an exciting opportunity to join their team.

summary: MusicBox UofT is seeking volunteers for the 2024-2025 year to teach music to marginalized children. The application deadline is September 29th, 2024, at 11:59 PM. Volunteers will receive training and can earn CCR certification.
